thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: Nigeria central bank injects $210 mln into currency market

title: Nigeria central bank injects $210 mln into currency market
text:
April 18, 2018 / 5:45 PM / Updated 35 minutes ago Nigeria central bank injects $210 mln into currency market Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ABUJA, April 18 (Reuters) - Nigeriaâ€™s central bank said on Wednesday it had injected $210 million into the interbank foreign exchange market, extending efforts to boost liquidity and alleviate dollar shortages. 
The bank said in a statement it had released $100 million earmarked for the wholesale market, $55 million for small businesses and individuals, and $55 million for certain dollar expenses such as school fees and medical bills. (Reporting by Paul Carsten Editing by Richard Balmforth)
